section.title: Property
section.para: The property handler listens on the property attribute just like Apache Ant, consider the following application.ini example:
section.programlisting:
[production]
majisti.property.applicationUrl = APPLICATION_URL majisti.property.baseUrl = "my-project/public" majisti.property.imagesUrl = #{baseUrl}/images majisti.property.scriptsUrl = #{baseUrl}/scripts majisti.property.locale = en
images.thumbsUp = #{imagesUrl}/thumbs-up.png app.aLink = #{baseUrl}/foo
section.para: Every occurences will get replaced with their proper properties. You can also use properties when defining other ones, as long as the defining property uses a property before it. It cannot work on succedent properties. Those are meant to allegiate repetitive content throughout the entire config and will work with included configuration using the Import handler.

To disable the property handler, you can always disable it in your configuration:resources.configHandler.property = 0
The Property and Import handlers are enabled by default within Majisti. They must explicitely be disabled in the configuration if you don't want to use them. Moreover, they make use of the namespace majisti to keep from interfering with your custom keys.
